Package game

Class GameGui

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • game.GameGui
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.WindowListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RummyGui
    public abstract class GameGui
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.WindowListener
    This represents the game's graphical user interface. As such, it extends JFrame.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • submitAction

        protected final void submitAction​(java.lang.String actionType)
        submit an action to the player. This will cause me to respond to an event in the GUI's main thread. (Typically, this is called by the game from the game's thread.)
        Parameters:
        actionType - a string describing the action (e.g., "you won").

      • requestMove

        public void requestMove()
        Lets the player know that it should make a move. Typically called by the game object.

      • notYourMove

        public void notYourMove()
        Notifies the player know that it's not his move. Typically called by the game object when the player has made a move out-of-turn.

      • illegalMove

        public void illegalMove()
        Notifies a player that the move he made is illegal. (For example, moving a non-king checkers-piece backwards.) Typically called by the game object when an illegal move has been detected.

      • timeToQuit

        public void timeToQuit()
        Notifies a player that it is time to quit. Typically called by the game object when a player has indicated a desire to quit.

      • invalidRequest

        public void invalidRequest()
        Notifies a player that a request he had made is invalid. (For example, if the player request a "quit", but he is not allowed to.) Typically called by the game object.

      • gameIsOver

        public void gameIsOver()
        Notifies a player that the game is over. Typically called by the game object when the game has been terminated.

      • stateChanged

        public void stateChanged()
        Notifies a player that the state of the game has changed. Typically called by the game object when an opponent has made a move, and the player may want to take the move into account (e.g., to display it on the screen).

      • windowDeactivated

        public void windowDeactivated​(java.awt.event.WindowEvent e)
        Invoked when a window is no longer the user's active window, which means that keyboard events will no longer be delivered to the window or its sub-components.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        e - the event object

      • finishUp

        public void finishUp()
        Notifies the player that all players have acknowledged that the game will be "quit". Gives the player last chance to "clean up". (E.g., closing windows, terminating network connections, closing files.) Typically called by the Game object just before the entire program terminates.
